page.title: 10ECOLOGY.
page.content: It is extremely difficult to leave the main roads when walking in the village.The pattern of farming is such that there is only a small acreage of meadows left and that is fenced off for sheep or horses. Many footpaths have gone and even minor roads have been labelled private. There is little left of the old village to conserve, many houses have been altered or restored. The hedgerows have been drastically erased. It will be necessary to be much more vigilant to preserve the few remaining footpaths and sideroads. In an area of such cold winds,trees and hedges are of special significance. There is little pollution in the streams and rivers, but spraying the crops is posing a new threat.
